event.name: GUARD_OG_DAWN_DESTROY
event.text: You have defeated the New Dawn guard. Whatever might have been in their cargo has for certain been destroyed, but you can at least salvage some supplies from the ship.

event.name: GUARD_OG_DAWN_DEADCREW
event.text: You have defeated the New Dawn guard. Without crew on board to stop you, you can investigate their cargo. You find a weapon to bring back to the ship, and move on to scrap their hull.

event.name: GUARD_OG_DAWN_FOLLOWUP
event.text: By killing the New Dawn guard, you have no doubt caused them to dispatch reinforcements to track you down. Watch your step as you explore the sector.

event.name: REINFORCEMENTS_OG_DAWN

beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: A New Dawn ship moves in to attack! Based on the vengeful look in their captain's eye, this is no doubt the ship dispatched by the guard to hunt you down!

textList.name: TEXT_START_OG_DAWN_UNIQUE
textList.text: What was previously just like any other Iron Watch settlement has become home to the New Dawn's military. Anyone who opposed the faction is now long gone, but the faction is desperately in need of support, especially of a powerful renegade like yourself.

The New Dawn is a splinter group of the Iron Watch, the previously Iron Watch members have come here to organise their military forces against the Iron Watch. The New Dawn however is desperately in need of support, especially of a powerful renegade like yourself.

event.name: GUARD_OG_DAWN_FRIENDLY
event.text: Instead of immediately deploying their weapons against you, the guard reaches out via comms. "Listen, good word has spread about you, but I don't wanna get on the bad side of the rebellion just on good word, so if you could send a little scrap my way we can both come out of this with what we want."

choice.text: We refuse to pay the bribe, fight your way through!

event.text: You mute the ship and prepare for combat.
The guard nods and combs over the scrap for a brief moment. "Very well, if anyone asks you came through on the previous shift."
"Oh, I wasn't aware, here we have some supplies on hand to help those like you."
"I suppose there's no risk if you've got rebels onboard, very well."

choice.text: (Mind Control) Convince the guard to leave you alone.
(Mind Control Weapon) Convince the guard to leave you alone.
(Mind Affecting Weapon) Induce chaos within the guard and slip past.
(Adv. Engines) Try to escape the guard.
(Adv. Piloting) Activate the auto-pilot to try and escape.

event.name: GUARD_OG_DAWN
event.text: The guard hails you. "Hey, it's nothing personal but the rebellion's got a problem with you and now that makes it a problem for me."
You rush to defensive positions as the guard approaches menacingly.
You hope this is enough to satisfy them...
"Funny, I just can't seem to remember who gave me this scrap... Now hurry along before I change my mind."

choice.text: (Mind Control) Convince the guard to leave you alone.
(Mind Control Weapon) Convince the guard to leave you alone.
(Mind Affecting Weapon) Induce chaos within the guard and slip past.
(Adv. Engines) Try to escape the guard.
(Adv. Piloting) Activate the auto-pilot to try and escape.

event.name: GUARD_OG_DAWN_CRIMINAL
event.text: It appears you've become quite famous here as the guard station has immediately gone into high alert, there's avoiding the fight now.

event.name: REPUTATION_UPDATE_OG_DAWN
event.text:
[REPUTATION INCREASED - NEW DAWN] Your actions here have improved your reputation within the New Dawn, at the cost of your reputation with the Iron Watch. Certain members might be more willing to interact with you.
[NOTORIETY INCREASED - GENERAL] Your actions here, justifiable or not, will not reflect well in the eyes of the Federation or its citizens. Continuously perform actions like this and you might start to see negative reactions from the Federation and its allies.

event.name: REPUTATION_UPDATE_DOUBLE_OG_DAWN
event.text:
[REPUTATION INCREASED X2 - NEW DAWN] Your actions here have improved your reputation within the New Dawn, at the cost of your reputation with the Iron Watch. Certain members might be more willing to interact with you. For your outstanding actions, your reputation was increased twice.
[NOTORIETY INCREASED - GENERAL] Your actions here, justifiable or not, will not reflect well in the eyes of the Federation or its citizens. Continuously perform actions like this and you might start to see negative reactions from the Federation and its allies.

event.name: REPUTATION_UPDATE_OG_DAWN_COMBAT

[REPUTATION INCREASED - NEW DAWN] Your actions here have improved your reputation within the New Dawn, at the cost of your reputation with the Iron Watch. Certain members might be more willing to interact with you.

event.name: REPUTATION_DECREASE_OG_DAWN
event.text: [REPUTATION DECREASED - NEW DAWN] Your actions here will reflect poorly within the New Dawn. They might no longer feel comfortable around you, if you had previously gained reputation before.

event.name: REPUTATION_DECREASE_OG_DAWN_COMBAT
event.text: [REPUTATION DECREASED - NEW DAWN] Your actions here will reflect poorly within the New Dawn. They might no longer feel comfortable around you, if you had previously gained reputation before.

event.name: REPUTATION_DECREASE_DOUBLE_OG_DAWN_COMBAT
event.text: [REPUTATION DECREASED X2 - NEW DAWN] Your actions here will reflect poorly within the New Dawn. They might no longer feel comfortable around you, if you had previously gained reputation before. For your extra egregious actions, your reputation was decreased twice.

textList.name: TEXT_DESTROYED_OG_DAWN
textList.text: The Iron Watch captain lets out one final expletive as the ship is obliterated.
The hull of the Iron Watch vessel is dispersed out into space. You swoop in to salvage the remains.
The Iron Watch ship explodes, extinguishing all lives within. Your crew avoids their remains as they salvage the ship pieces.
One of the turrets is launched off into empty space as the ship explodes, throwing valuable debris in every direction.

textList.name: TEXT_DEAD_CREW_OG_DAWN
textList.text: "Your bloodlust... will be your downfall someday, Renegade. You are only proof... the Federation... is no better than the Rebellion..."
Without a word, the Iron Watch captain falls to the ground, gasping for air as the life is extinguished from their eyes. You salvage the hull of their ship.
"You will regret this! Karma always comes back to people like you. Damn you Renegades... the Iron Watch would have been better off with the Rebellion..."

event.name: ESCAPE_OG_DAWN
event.text: Scans show that the Iron Watch ship is trying to escape. Destroy it before it can get away!

textList.name: TEXT_GOTAWAY_OG_DAWN
textList.text: The Iron Watch vessel has slipped from your grasp, abandoning you at the beacon.
Your attempts at destroying the Iron Watch vessel have failed, and the ship has escaped.

event.name: GOTAWAY_OG_DAWN_REMAINS
event.text: The Iron Watch vessel may have escaped, but not everything has gone wrong. A trail of scrap from the wreckage has been left behind, which you collect.

event.name: STOREEVENT_OG_DAWN_TURRET
event.text: A New Dawn merchant has setup at an outpost nearby, an occasional customer visits the outpost, but there's enough time for you to get in without attracting unwanted attention.

You enter the outpost to discover a wide variety of items on sale, the usual stuff is there, crates of fuel, drone parts, and missiles, but towards one wall you find an unusual turret on display, locked up tight behind bullet proof glass. "Surplus New Dawn Equipment: Ask at the counter"

choice.text: Inquire about the surplus New Dawn equipment.

event.text: The merchant, a short looking human, replies; "Ahhh, a keen eye you have ehh. That there is a genuine New Dawn produced Turret- Hey wait you aren't with New Dawn are you? or those rebels?"

"No, reason, was just curious. Anyway, as I was saying this is a genuine New Dawn turret, some of the most powerful equipment you can find." The merchant puts a high price on it, but clearly its a good piece of equipment.

choice.text: (New Dawn Crew) Quietly report him to the New Dawn.
(Rebel Crew) Quietly report him to the New Dawn.
(New Dawn Crew) Confront him about how he acquired the turret.
(Rebel Crew) Confront him about how he acquired the turret.
Ignore the offer and just shop.
(New Dawn Crew) We're with the New Dawn.

event.text: You aren't looking to attract the attention of any rebel sympathisers.

event.name: STOREEVENT_OG_DAWN_TURRET_COVERUP
event.text: The merchant now sweating nervously continues, "As I was saying, That there ISN'T a genuine New Dawn Turret, rather its a uhm. a, Replica, yes a replica, it doesn't function at all. It's meerly a collectors piece, you wouldn't be interested in it."

choice.text: The merchant steers the conversation away from the turret, you'll need extra information to push it any further.

event.text: Your scans indicated that it actually isn't a replica and rather a real New Dawn turret.

choice.text: Report the merchant to the New Dawn.

event.name: STOREEVENT_OG_DAWN_TURRET_COVERUP_REPORT
event.text: You quietly report the merchant to the local authorities using the information you collected, before they arrive you're able to do some shopping.

choice.text: Offer to compensate him for "seizing" the New Dawn turret.

event.name: STOREEVENT_OG_DAWN_TURRET_COVERUP_PURCHASE_100
event.text: After you assure him that the New Dawn won't find out about this, he's happy to hand it off to you for a good price.

choice.text: Threaten to report him if he doesn't lower the price.

event.name: STOREEVENT_OG_DAWN_TURRET_COVERUP_THREATEN
event.text: The merchant agrees to the deal for a cheaper price. Although strangely didn't seem too scared of your threats.

choice.text: Compensate him the agreed amount for "seizing" the New Dawn turret.

event.name: STOREEVENT_OG_DAWN_TURRET_COVERUP_PURCHASE_80
event.text: After you assure him that the New Dawn won't find out about this, he's happy to hand it off to you for a good price.

choice.text: Threaten to report him if he doesn't lower the price again.

event.text: You take a harsh tone and threaten the merchant again, but this time the merchant is even less concerned. Eventually you look over at the Turret to realize its gone, the merchant managed to hide it without you realizing, with nothing to report your threats fall flat.

choice.text: (Iron Watch Crew) Your Iron Watch technician recognises that the turret isn't a replica.

event.text: Your technician quietly reveals that the merchant is lying about it being a replica, perhaps you can use this to your advantage?

choice.text: Report the merchant to the New Dawn.
Offer to compensate him for "seizing" the New Dawn turret.
Threaten to report him if he doesn't lower the price.

event.name: STOREEVENT_OG_DAWN_TURRET_COVERUP_REVEALED
event.text: "I uh, uh found it nearby, just floating around, yeah it was just floating in space and I picked it up, nothing illegal."

choice.text: Report the merchant to the New Dawn.
Offer to compensate him for "seizing" the New Dawn turret.
Threaten to report him if he doesn't lower the price.

event.name: OG_DAWN_DEBRIS_FIELD
event.text: You've arrived at the beacon to discover the wreck of a New Dawn vessel. Theres nothing in the area that indicates a battle took place here, instead it appears the wreck was created by the asteroid field here, if you want to search the debris you'll need to enter the asteroid field.
You stay out of danger and prepare for your next jump.

You search the debris field, but it seems like there's nothing of value here. Unfortunately, the asteroid field is both loose and densely packed, so you'll have to avoid damage as you charge your FTL drive!

You search the debris field, but it seems like there's nothing of value here. Unfortunately, the asteroid field is both loose and densely packed, so you'll have to avoid damage as you charge your FTL drive!
You search the debris field. Amidst the largely worthless junk, you manage to track down a hidden supply of missiles in a large cargo container that survived.
You search the debris field. While much of it is worthless junk, you manage to scrounge up a small amount of useful resources.
You search the debris field. The material itself is mostly worthless junk. However, amidst the unremarkable debris, you find what seems to be an escape pod with markings matching that of the ship.
From out of the escape pod, a lone New Dawn Soldier stumbles. "...I thought I was a goner. That asteroid field was far more dangerous than we expected... I'm lucky to be alive."

event.name: OG_DAWN_SUPPLIES_NEEDED
event.text: Docked to a nearby New Dawn outpost is a large transport ship belonging to the New Dawn, your scans indicate that the transport is unusually empty.

"A Federation Renagade? I didn't think I'd see your kind around here, worry not there are no rebels around, we do not have to be enemies." The Captain of the transport pauses, thinking on something. "Say, you don't have any spare supplies on you, we were meant to collect supplies from this outpost, but apparently they never recieved any from the last transport." "We'd be happy to pay you with some surplus equipment or personnel."

choice.text: Request one of their soldiers in exchange for supplies.

event.text: You dock with the transport and hand over the supplies, you're greeted by your new crew member, "To be honest I always wanted to work on a real war ship, the transport is safe and all, but it gets real boring on there."

choice.text: Request one of their soldiers in exchange for supplies.

event.text: You dock with the transport and hand over the supplies, you're greeted by your new crew member, "To be honest I always wanted to work on a real war ship, the transport is safe and all, but it gets real boring on there."

choice.text: Request they put in good word for you with the rest of the New Dawn in exchange for supplies.

event.text: You dock with the transport and hand over the supplies, you're greeted by the transport's Captain, "You know, those rebels really made the Federation sound awful, but you really don't seem that bad."

choice.text: "Sorry we can't spare any extra supplies."

event.text: You wish them luck and prepare for your next jump.
"Federation scum, don't come any closer, we don't want any trouble but we aren't opposed to ripping your ship to threads."

choice.text: Eject some supplies towards them as a sign of good will.

event.text: The transport carefully scoops up the supplies, keeping their turrets trained on you. "Hmmph, I suppose not all of you are terrible, good luck out there Captain." With that the transport carefully retreats to the safety of the outpost.

choice.text: Wait for them to leave the outpost before attacking.

event.text: Eventually the transport finishes their buisiness with the outpost and begins to head off, once out of range of the outpost you carefully intercept them with guns blazing.
You keep your distance and prepare for your next jump.

choice.text: Wait for them to leave the outpost before attacking.

You keep your distance and prepare for your next jump.

event.name: OG_DAWN_OUTPOST_FLEET
event.text: You arrive at the beacon face to face with a large communications outpost, you detect a large number of encrypted communications being sent towards the rebel fleet, the outpost appears mostly undefended, you could destroy it for salvage without taking more than a few points of hull damage.
"Ahh, the Federation Renegade we've been hearing about, worry not, the rebellion doesn't know you're here. Yet."

choice.text: Request the outpost delay the rebel fleet.

event.text: "Hmmph, I suppose we can, I just hope this doesn't get traced back to me."

choice.text: Request the outpost route the fleet through a specific position so that you can lay a trap there.

event.text: "Hmmph, I suppose we can, I just hope this doesn't get traced back to me."
"You, you're a Federation Renegade! Give me one good reason I shouldn't report you to the fleet right now!"
"Hmmph, I suppose I can let you go, just get out of here before the rebellion finds out."

choice.text: (New Dawn Crew) Request the outpost delay the rebel fleet.

event.text: "Hmmph, I suppose I can, I just hope this doesn't get traced back to me."

choice.text: (Rebel Crew) Request the outpost delay the rebel fleet.

event.text: "Hmmph, I suppose I can, I just hope this doesn't get traced back to me."

choice.text: Tell them you were just about to leave.

event.text: They decide not to report you, you keep your distance and prepare for your next jump.

choice.text: The outpost refuses any attempts to make contact due to your negative reputation.
Wreck it for scrap and supplies.

event.text: You open fire on the outpost, it quickly disintergrates under your weapons, it's underpowered turrets only landing a few hits on you. Unfortunately it was able to alert the rebel fleet to your position before it was destroyed.
You keep your distance and prepare for your next jump.

event.name: OG_DAWN_REBEL_DAWN_INFIGHT
event.text: You arrive at the beacon face to face with both a New Dawn vessel and Rebel ship, you immediately prepare yourself for the coming battle before realizing that the ships aren't interested in you, instead they've actually got their weapons trained on each other. From what you can hear over public communications you get the sense that the New Dawn Captain is sick of having to listen to the commands of these "stupid rebel captains who couldn't tell the arse end of a slug from their own mother." And the Rebel Captain is quite displeased with insubordination of the New Dawn ship.
You arm you weapons and move into engage the New Dawn ship, you have a moment to consider your decision again, you could escape now and avoid the fight if you pulled off now.
You turn tail and run away, the two ships turn their attention back to each other while you prepare for your next jump.
You arm you weapons and move into engage the Rebel ship, you have a moment to consider your decision again, you could escape now and avoid the fight if you pulled off now.
You turn tail and run away, the two ships turn their attention back to each other while you prepare for your next jump.

choice.text: Use the confusion to escape and avoid any conflict.

event.text: You keep your distance and prepare for your next jump.

event.name: OG_DAWN_REBEL_DAWN_INFIGHT_DAWN_FOLLOWUP
event.text: With the Rebel vessel dealt with, the New Dawn ship doesn't make any moves to engage you, you're unsure of their next move.

"Ahh, the Federation Renegade we've been hearing about, I'm really starting to think this alliance with the rebellion was a huge mistake, these guys are awful." The Captain pauses for a moment thinking. "Here take these supplies, we were originally meant to deliver them to the Rebel outpost nearby but I doubt they'll ever notice it never arrived."

"You, you're a Federation Renegade. I'm probably supposed to shoot you now, but then again I was supposed to follow that idiot's orders and look how that turned out. Thanks for dealing with them by the way, keeps my hands clean, I'll be sure to spread the good word about you." With that the ship jumps away, clearly keen to be away of the whole thing.

choice.text: The ship refuses any attempts to make contact due to your negative reputation.

event.text: The New Dawn ship is clearly surprised by you moving to engage them, they turn on their weapons in response.

event.name: OG_DAWN_REBEL_DAWN_INFIGHT_REBEL_FOLLOWUP
event.text: With the New Dawn vessel dealt with, the Rebel ship doesn't make any moves to engage you, but it doesn't seem like you should expect any thanks either.

choice.text: Use the uneasy peace and back away to avoid any conflict.

event.text: You keep your distance and prepare for your next jump.

event.name: OG_DAWN_NEUTRAL_SHIP_PULSAR
event.text: You've arrived at the beacon unnoticed, This area of space is relatively uninhabited due to the pulsar, only a single New Dawn vessel shows up on sensors, and it appears they aren't aware of you yet.

"Ah, The famous Renegade that has been visiting out sector, I've heard good things about you. I don't suppose you could help me, I've been sent here to hunt down a rogue Iron Watch vessel, but I cannot find it. I would appreciate your help in the search."

You agree to help and split off from the New Dawn ship, after a few minutes of searching the New Dawn ship disapears off into the distance, beyond the range of your sensors. It's only a few minutes later that the Iron Watch vessel appears, revealed behind a large by slow asteroid. They correctly deduce you're apart of the hunting team and don't give you a chance, prepare to fight.
You rush in to get the upper hand, unfortunately the ship notices you and is able to prepare for the battle.
You keep your distance and prepare for your next jump.
"You're not who I'm looking for, stay out of my way and we'll have no problems."
You rush in to get the upper hand, unfortunately the ship notices you and is able to prepare for the battle.
You keep your distance and prepare for your next jump.

choice.text: Making contact would just result in them attacking you due to your negative reputation.

event.text: You rush in to get the upper hand, unfortunately the ship notices you and is able to prepare for the battle.
You keep your distance and prepare for your next jump.

event.name: OG_DAWN_NEUTRAL_SHIP
event.text: You've arrived at the beacon unnoticed, The only New Dawn vessel nearby hasn't noticed you yet...
"Ah, the Renegade Captain, I don't suppose you have any spare supplies on hand, we're running low on fuel and drone parts, we have the scrap to compensate you."
You transfer them the supplies and recieve their scrap, a good old fashion exchange of resources.
You rush in to get the upper hand, unfortunately the ship notices you and is able to prepare for the battle.
You keep your distance and prepare for your next jump.
"I'm not looking for a fight, stay out of my way and we'll have no problems."
You rush in to get the upper hand, unfortunately the ship notices you and is able to prepare for the battle.
You keep your distance and prepare for your next jump.

choice.text: Making contact would just result in them attacking you due to your negative reputation.

event.text: You rush in to get the upper hand, unfortunately the ship notices you and is able to prepare for the battle.

event.name: OG_DAWN_DISTRESS_ASTEROID
event.text: You've arrived in an asteroid field, the distress beacon is coming from a wrecked New Dawn transport just off to the side of the beacon.

You pull up close to the wreckage, there are several cargo containers in amongst the debris but they all appear openned, someone's been here already. A moment later you find out who that is, a New Dawn scout reveals themselves from behind some asteroids, it's apparent they've taken some damage to their engines by the thin line of oil and other fluids leaking behind them.

The Captain of the ship sounds frantic, "Please, Captain, you've got to help us, I've rescued everyone I could find but our ship isn't going to last much longer, I beg you to take us and our cargo onboard and out of the asteroid field, theres an outpost nearby."
It's going to take time to load everyone onboard and get to the outpost, you'll need to survive the asteroid for about 30 seconds.
Instead of helping them out you immediately engage your weapons, if any of them survive this they're not going to be so trusting of random federation ships in the future.
You keep your distance and prepare for your next jump.
Instead of hearing them out you immediately engage your weapons, if any of them survive this they're not going to be so trusting of random federation ships in the future.
You keep your distance and prepare for your next jump.

event.name: OG_DAWN_DISTRESS_ASTEROID_LOADED
event.text: You manage to load everyone onboard just in time, not a moment later an asteroid hits the enemy ship, causing a rapid depressurisation event. It will only take a little bit longer to make it to the outpost.

triggeredEventBox.tooltip: Time to make it to the outpost.

event.name: OG_DAWN_DISTRESS_ASTEROID_OUTPOST
event.text: You've made it, you dock with the outpost and everyone makes it off successfully. The crew of the ship are very thankful, One of the New Dawn Soldier comes up to you, "Do you think I could join your ship as one of your crew, it was pretty boring working on the transport escort, atleast up until I thought we were going to die."
You're joined by your new crewmember onboard the ship.
As you search the wreckage of the ship you come across a strange cargo container, it even has it's destination recorded on the side, you take it onboard.
As you search the remains of the ship you come across a strange cargo container, it even has it's destination recorded on the side, you take it onboard.

event.name: OG_DAWN_PREIGN_QUEST
event.text: The distress beacon originates from a damaged New Dawn bomber parked nearby, your scans indicate that their engines are heavily damaged, they're not going to be going anywhere soon.

"You're no New Dawn, but I have heard of you helping the other out, We've got an important piece of cargo onboard that needs to make it to a nearby base, we'll make sure you're compensated well if you deliver it there."
They transfer the cooridinates and the cargo crate over to you, they give a quick warning to not open it before sending you on your way.
Weapon's armed you plan on taking the cargo, and their ship by force.
You keep your distance and prepare for your next jump.

choice.text: Your attempts to make contact are immediately cut off when they realize who you are, it appears they were hoping for one of their own to come to the rescue.

event.text: Weapon's armed you plan on taking their ship by force.
You keep your distance and prepare for your next jump.

event.name: OG_DAWN_PREIGN_QUEST_DESTINATION

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: The intended destination of the cargo container.

event.text: You arrive at the beacon to discover a large military installation, the destination on the cargo crate specifies a specific docking port to head to.

You ship glides into place at the docking port, You head out into the military installation but are stopped just outside. "This docking port was designated for special delivery, please move your ship to a different port."

choice.text: "Oh, Actually we are the delivery crew."

event.text: "Oh, well where's the Cargo Crate then?"

choice.text: (Cargo Crate) Show her the Cargo Crate.

event.text:
"Oh you weren't lying, there it is, please bring it and follow me, its not far from here."
A moment later you find yourself in an odd looking labratory, there are several unattended tables around the room, but you're directed to a slightly larger one in the middle.

A scientist or perhaps an engineer walks over, "Ah excellent it's here." He pops the crate open and begin rummaging through it, looking for something. "Ah excellent, it was in here." He pulls out a strange looking device, you recognise it as one of the New Dawn's Turret Pre-energisers, although it appears modified. The engineer takes it to the table and begins connecting it up to several other components from the table.

He turns his attention to you, not appearing to actually care who he's talking to. "I present the Turret PRE-IGNITER, an enhanced version of our successful Pre-energiser. I suppose putting this together wasn't neccessary, but I like to have a final prototype, it makes it feel complete.

Not a moment later the entire station is rocked by a large explosion, sirens and alarms start blaring and people start rushing through, the engineer turns to a nearby console, quickly bringing up the station's exterior camera's. On the vid screen you can makeout a strange looking ship silhouetted against the nearby star. "It's just as I suspected." The engineer turns towards you. "Captain, what kind of ship do you have?" "A cruiser, excellent, take the Turret Pre-igniter, I've saved the designs to a secure datacenter, but I cannot risk the physical prototype falling into their hands, please take it with you and get out of here, whatever you do, do not let it fall into the Rebellion's hands."

You rush back to your ship, desperate to get it away from the installation before it gets damaged in the confusion. You undock for the station and begin to drift away when the hostile ship turns it's attention to you, warnings lightup across the cockpit warning you of the danger, prepare for combat.

choice.text: "Ohh, uh we don't have it anymore."

event.text: "Right, well I'd recommend you move off before I have to throw you out of the airlock." You quickly return to your ship and prepare for your next jump.
You move your ship off of the docking port and prepare for your next jump.
You keep your distance and prepare for your next jump.

event.name: OG_DAWN_PREIGN_LEGION_DEFEAT
event.text: The Rebel vessel has been defeated, leaving behind plenty of scrap matter, the unusual turret mounted to the ship survived with only a few minor dents and scratches. Surprisingly, you still detect faint life signs aboard the wreck as you scrap it...

You move closer, tearing open the cargo bay to find a wounded Rebel soldier. As soon as you approach he panics, reaching for a sharp piece of metal, and plunges it deep into his chest. An act of suicide, likely trying to stop you from getting information... but on what?

Seems most of the data on the ship was purged during the fight - a strange practice, but it seems they knew their fate before the fight had even begun. Whatever this ship was, it was under very clear orders not to let anything leak. Maybe this won't be the last time you see a ship like this, though that's very uncertain.

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_OG_DAWN
textList.text: As you jump into the system a New Dawn ship advances on your position. They are refusing all hails. Prepare for a fight.
Soon after arriving in the system you are hailed by a small cruiser. "What good fortune that we happen to run into each other. Nothing personal, but you have some information we need!"
The only other ship at this beacon messages you: "Finally, after months of waiting, someone has fallen into our trap!"
You barely have time to register jump completion before your ship warns you of an incoming ship with weapons hot.

event.name: OG_DAWN_HEIST_START
event.text: You've arrived at the beacon face to face with a pair of Iron Watch ships, one of them is just a common figher, but the other is an unusual design, a larger cruiser sized ship. An unusual sight in this sector, most of the Iron Watch were either forced out, or joined their leaders in turning to the New Dawn.

Just as you were initiating contact with the Iron Watch vessel, alarms go off on your consoles, another ship have arrived, and this time it's not the Iron Watch. beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: The location of the Iron Watch's secret base.

event.text: You've arrived at the rendevouz point, the New Dawn cruiser is there already. "You're here Captain, we can set-off then, follow me and prepare for combat."

You follow the cruiser, passing by several large asteroids floating in the void. You don't even realize when you get to the Iron Watch base until you're right up against it, you pickup the faintest blip on your sensors in the center of a large asteroid, protected from detection by the thick layer of rock. Now that you know where their base is it doesn't take you long to locate the entrance, a natural cave in the asteroid that leads inwards.

You eventually make it out into a cavernous space, smaller than you expected but packed with cargo containers and a few temporary structures. However a quick scan indicates that the base is empty, abandoned. The New Dawn ship realizing this aswell quickly turns back the way you came, with full power to their engines. "Captain, we've made a mistake, they've already moved on the data-vault, I need to get back there now!"

Once outside, "We're heading back to the data-vault, I want you to stay here, in case they've simply moved somewhere else nearby, or worse, completed their mission already and are on their way back. If anyone shows up we can't risk them escaping with the data, do not let them escape." With that they leave, heading off towards the data-vault.

Just when you were getting bored, a ship appears on your sensors, at first you think it's the New Dawn ship returning, but it quickly resolves to be an Iron Watch ship, the same ship that escaped from you earlier. Upon seeing you they also activate their weapons, preparing to attack. You notice however that it appears their engines are damage, it appears they're attempting an emergency jump to escape, but it will take a few minutes due to the damage, now is your chance.
